intro: Urvillea tridentata, commonly known as the three-toothed urvillea, is a flowering plant native to Madagascar. It belongs to the family Malvaceae and is characterized by its distinctive three-lobed leaves. The plant produces small, yellowish flowers that are clustered in inflorescences. It is often found in dry, rocky habitats and is adapted to the arid conditions of its native environment. Urvillea tridentata is of interest to botanists due to its unique morphology and ecological significance in its region.
